relation: Referred to the committee on State Administration and Regulatory Oversight
Hearing scheduled for 11/06/2013 from 01:00 PM-04:00 PM in B-2
Bill reported favorably by committee and referred to the committee on House Steering, Policy and Scheduling
Committee reported that the matter be placed in the Orders of the Day for the next sitting for a second reading
Read second and ordered to a third reading
title: Actions for Bill H.2901
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {318=By Mr. Walsh of Boston, a petition (accompanied by bill, House, No. 2901) of Martin J. Walsh and others for the issuance of an annual proclamation by the Governor designating October 18 as inflammatory breast cancer awareness day. State Administration and Regulatory Oversight.}
textBeforeTable: Section 15SSSSS. The governor shall annually issue a proclamation setting apart October 18 as Inflammatory Breast Cancer Awareness Day to raise awareness of the occurrence of inflammatory breast cancer and to encourage regular testing for inflammatory breast cancer amongst all citizens of the commonwealth and recommending that the day be observed in an appropriate manner by the people. SECTION 1. Chapter 6 of the General Laws is hereby amended by inserting after section 15RRRRR, the following section:— Miscellaneous Bill History Current Bill Text Print Preview Download PDF View Formatted Document Download text: Referred to House Committee on Bills in the Third Reading
